Hi Team,
Our development time is being significantly hampered by persistent crafting issues, with an alarming 50% of our team's time currently dedicated to debugging and finding workarounds. This demands our immediate and dedicated attention.
Here's a breakdown of the critical issues:
1. *Crafting Sandbox Bootup Failure (ecr-login):* While a workaround exists, it's a short-term solution requiring manual intervention every 6 hours or after each sandbox restart.
2. *Data Sources Not Indexing in Crafting:* Data sources mounted to crafting are failing to index. Entries are added to ``ingestion_items``, but the calls are not reaching ``job-service`` or ``celery-app-tasks``. This is a major blocker for the chatbot team's development.
3. *Non-Persistent Indexes in Crafting:* Every sandbox restart results in the loss of all indexes in ``wevaiate-titan``. This is extremely frustrating as it invalidates all chatbots and leads to the complete loss of any previously indexed data sources.
The inability to test data sources in crafting is completely blocked due to these issues.
LMK, If I can be of help in any way, let's try to close on these.
cc: @Balaram @mfichman @Gaurav Saini

1 => I don't think I have permission to create the required keys (cc @Abhinav) but I'll give it a try today anyway.

2 => OK. Have you done any debugging yet? logs, etc.
@Jeff -- can you help @Gauti look into #2? Ty!
Sure
For 3, have you tried pinning the sandbox? This prevents the sandbox from being hibernated

(3) is easily solved by adding a volume mount path on the `make run-docker` command for weaviate titan. I just need to know where weaviate puts its state on the FS within the container, and I can easily fix this.
BTW, another way to fix (1) is to use IAM for Crafting sandboxes. We've discussed this, and it is possible.

I think cronjobs are not able to put the items into the queue, which can trigger the digitization tasks. But it's a generic issue and happening for every sandbox.

fix for #3:

This uses a named volume rather than /tmp, which does not stick around across reboots due to tmpfs

```diff --git a/third-party/docker/weaviate-titan/Makefile b/third-party/docker/weaviate-titan/Makefile
index 4a29aa0b00c..a2c50fb5f04 100644
--- a/third-party/docker/weaviate-titan/Makefile
+++ b/third-party/docker/weaviate-titan/Makefile
@@ -17,8 +17,8 @@ run-docker: build-env-docker
        mkdir -p /tmp/weaviate-titan && $(DOCKER_RUN_CMD) \
         --name instabase-$(IMAGE_NAME) \
         --env-file $(current_dir)/tmp/docker_env_local.list \
-        -p $(PORT):8888 --user=root \
-        -v /tmp/weaviate-titan:/var/lib/weaviate \
+        --publish $(PORT):8888 --user=root \
+        --volume weaviate-titan:/var/lib/weaviate \
         --rm -i $(IMAGE_FQN)```
